image.altText: An aerial shot of white roofed houses.

props.synopsis: Domain's September quarterly report shows house rents across the country's combined capitals have remained stable for five consecutive quarters.

title.children: Rental prices stabilise but remain at 'record highs', report shows

image.altText: A mockup of an architecturally designed building that incorporates gold cladding and lots of windows

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory treasurer says the federal government will not support the proposed Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander art gallery in Alice Springs in its current form.

title.children: Federal support for national Aboriginal art gallery in Alice Springs in doubt

image.altText: A young boy in a sporting team singlet plays by a river

props.synopsis: The death of a three-year-old boy in an Alice Springs house fire has led to an electrical audit of Northern Territory public housing, which uncovered widespread issues affecting hundreds of homes, an inquest has heard.

title.children: Alice Springs boy's tragic house fire death yields public housing audit

image.altText: Mobile phone betting apps generic

props.synopsis: The NT government is standing by its de-facto regulation of Australia’s $50 billion online gambling industry, despite allegations that it is too closely linked to the sector.

title.children: NT government reviewing conflict allegations against gambling regulator

image.altText: A saltwater crocodile leaning up against a muddy brown bank, with black zip-ties around it's mouth.

props.synopsis: The discovery of a saltwater crocodile with its mouth bound shut by zip ties in a Darwin river has sparked outrage, with animal rights advocates calling for stronger wildlife protections.

title.children: Saltwater crocodile found with mouth zip-tied shut near Darwin

image.altText: Composite photo of Gordon Twaddle, Karen Edwards, and Tim Thomson.

props.synopsis: Gordon Twaddle, Karen Edwards, and Tim Thomson were killed almost 50 years ago. A second inquest into their deaths hopes to deliver answers for their loved ones.

title.children: Second inquest into cold case murders of trio in outback begins

image.altText: A group of primary aged kids in school uniforms walking on a red dirt road.

props.synopsis: Parents in the NT who frequently fail to send their children to school, without a valid reason, may have their income managed by the Commonwealth.

title.children: NT parents referred to income management if kids fail to attend class

image.altText: An aerial shot of a construction site near the ocean's edge, cranes can be seen below.

props.synopsis: It’s taken 10 years, blown out by hundreds of millions of dollars, and is still nowhere near becoming operational. Now there are calls for the Darwin ship lift project to be scrapped.

title.children: Ship lift project dubbed 'one of the biggest blowouts' in Australia

image.altText: A woman wearing black standing in the doorway opening of a tent.

props.synopsis: The war in Gaza may be ending soon, but those displaced by Israel's bombardment and invasion know their suffering is far from over.

title.children: After eight moves, Majeda is exhausted. This is her story of displacement in Gaza

image.altText: An SES volunteer in orange overalls walks across grassland towards a row of SES and police vehicles

props.synopsis: An expert in artificial intelligence says a fake image depicting missing four-year-old Gus being abducted in South Australia's outback highlights the dangerous link between AI and the spread of misinformation.

title.children: Expert says AI-generated image of missing boy Gus case raises serious concerns

image.altText: artie mintzas 2

props.synopsis: A close family member of Artemios Mintzas tells the ABC she asked police to visit his unit three weeks ago, after growing increasingly concerned about his state of mind.

title.children: 'We tried to help him': Family of alleged Sydney gunman speak out

image.altText: A green long narco sub

props.synopsis: Cousins Reubenson and Martin Fugui found a 'Made in Colombia' narco sub in Solomon Islands over the weekend — the third such vessel found in the country's waters over the past year.

title.children: 'Made in Colombia' narco sub found floating in Solomon Islands

image.altText: A large white and yellow ship with cranes and lifeboats on the side.

props.synopsis: Two years after the RSV Nuyina was banned from going under Hobart's Tasman Bridge to refuel, the Australian Antarctic Division has formally ditched the possibility of trying to overturn the decision.

title.children: Icebreaker's costly bridge ban won't be reassessed

image.altText: A man works in a furnace wearing protective equipment.

props.synopsis: The industry minister has defended a $600 million joint bailout of a Queensland copper smelter as "a good use of public resources". Follow live.

title.children: Minister defends $600m bailout of copper smelter as 'good use of public resources'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Ayres blames 'unfair trade practices' for repeated metal facility bailouts
'Absolutely not': Ley shuts down suggestion she leaked to media
Ley demands answers on return of Australian women from Syria

image.altText: Kerry Forrest standing on the street.

props.synopsis: In the three years that 65-year-old Kerry Forrest has been applying for positions, she has faced repeated rejection. She thinks it is time employers consider older workers more favourably.

title.children: 'I'm 65 that's what's different': Kerry has never had trouble finding work, until now

image.altText: A man with shoulder-length brown hair and beard looks neutrally at the camera

props.synopsis: Police arrested and charged Jonathan Rinderknecht over the fire this week, which was the most destructive in Los Angeles's history.

title.children: 'Evil people do evil things': Man charged over deadly Los Angeles fire

image.altText: Tight shot of a man seated at a microphone speaking.

props.synopsis: The guilty plea follows an extraordinary chain of events that saw Mr Trump publicly implore Attorney General Pam Bondi to take action against Mr Comey and other perceived adversaries.

title.children: Former FBI director James Comey pleads not guilty in Congress case

image.altText: A person at the beach applying sunblock to their arm.

props.synopsis: Summer is just around the corner, and many Australians are confused right now about which sunscreens they can trust.

title.children: Summer is approaching and Australians are confused about their sunscreens

image.altText: SNAICC CEO and Indigenous Commissioners

props.synopsis: Governments have been unable to reduce the rates of First Nations children in out-of-care and youth detention. Advocates say the new children's commissioner needs the power to hold them to account.

title.children: 'Listen and learn': Calls for First Nations commissioner to be given 'teeth'

image.altText: Man lying face down on the road, handcuffed behind his back next to a car with the door open. He's surrounded by police and cars

props.synopsis: It is a tried and true tactic in the underworld when trying to get away with murder, but police have sought out "kill cars" and they are reaping the rewards from it.

title.children: Police turn attention to use of 'kill cars' in attempted underworld hits

image.altText: Exterior of aged care facility in regional Victoria.

props.synopsis: An aged care facility in western Victoria receives an "unprecedented" donation that will allow it to enhance the lives of residents living with dementia.

title.children: Family donates $1.7m to reshape dementia care in Victorian town

image.altText: an image of a panoramic view showing a river reaching the sea in a tropical rainforest

props.synopsis: The Queensland Conservation Council (QCC) has called out the LNP government for "not taking the environment seriously" with the number of flora and fauna species under threat on the rise.

title.children: Queensland government called out for 'not taking environment seriously'

image.altText: Teenage girl posing on the lawn with a kart and a trophy

props.synopsis: With success at home and abroad, Annabel Kennedy is part of a growing number of Australian women and girls making their mark in motorsport.

title.children: Kennedy eyes F1 Academy after becoming first female on Indian F4 podium

image.altText: A close up of Hugh Marks grimacing

props.synopsis: A Federal Court judge found the ABC breached the Fair Work Act when it removed the journalist and broadcaster from the air during a five-day radio presenting contract.

title.children: ABC spent more than $2.5m defending legal action from Antoinette Lattouf

image.altText: A residential street with an ambulance and police officers setting up a crime scene.

props.synopsis: A man was found with gunshot wounds on a street in Riverstone, in Sydney's north-west. A short time later two burnt-out cars were discovered nearby.

title.children: Fatal shooting of man in Sydney's north-west a 'brazen' targeted attack

image.altText: A poster of the Nobel Prize medal, featuring Alfred Nobel, is seen in the background as a man reads a book

props.synopsis: Scientists Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar Yaghi receive the 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry "for the development of metal-organic frameworks", the award-giving body announces.

title.children: Scientists awarded Nobel Prize in Chemistry for work in 'metal-organic frameworks'

image.altText: A disability facility in suburban Adelaide.

props.synopsis: An audit has revealed an Adelaide aged care facility was inappropriately using restraints on patients, raising the question of whether the state government has learned from the Oakden aged care scandal in 2017.

title.children: Has the SA government learned from the Oakden aged care scandal?

image.altText: Ravi bends his knees to lift the weight, standing in the gym.

props.synopsis: Ravi Sood turned to the gym to help build muscle before a knee replacement. It has changed his life and led him to the World Masters Powerlifting Championships.

title.children: Powerlifting champion aged 82 and ready to represent Australia

image.altText: A man with a white beard talks into a microphone

props.synopsis: News Corp Australasia executive chairman Michael Miller issues a call to arms for all media companies to stand together and demand the government rule out any changes to copyright laws.

title.children: News Corp executive warns AI firms attempting 'Grand Theft Australia'

image.altText: An aerial shot showing extensive flooding of properties in a residential area

props.synopsis: Some 30,000 army officers and thousands of boats have been deployed to help with the recovery efforts and search for those still unaccounted for.

title.children: Eight people killed by record flooding in Vietnam with tens of thousands stranded

image.altText: man dressed in black t shirt holding knife standing behind a fence and in front of a synagogue

props.synopsis: British counter terror police say Jihad Al-Shamie called police during his attack on a Manchester synagogue to declare his allegiance to the terror group.

title.children: Manchester synagogue attacker pledged allegiance to Islamic State, police say

image.altText: A man works in a furnace wearing protective equipment.

props.synopsis: The bailout of another metals facility — this time in Queensland — is unlikely to be the last, with pressures on the sector driven by China to keep up for years.

title.children: The unspoken reason why the metals industry is being bailed out

image.altText: A collage of three men attempting to rescue a pink-and-grey galah from inside an electricity pole.

props.synopsis: A lifetime sailor says his experience problem-solving with limited resources helped figure out how to rescue a galah trapped in an 8-metre-tall power pole.

title.children: Mates take matters into their own hands to rescue trapped galah
